page.title: 08EVENTS PENTNEY & NARBORO'
page.content: The Pentney Church and Village Hall raise funds through an annual joint fete, bringing together various groups within the community. 1985 saw the first parade of floats as an extra attraction to the fete involving the Church, W.I., Village Hall and Mothers and Toddlers Club. Fund raising within the villages consists of pleasant events within residents homes such as coffee mornings, garden fetes, and sherry evenings. Events such as a sponsored bicycle ride and a barbeque raise money for worthy causes both within the village e.g. the Over 60's annual Christmas dinner and also outside e.g. the King's Lynn Hospital C.A.T. Scanner Appeal. The annual Grow Sew and Cook Show, organised by the W.I. unites both villages in friendly competition. A celebration was held to mark the 50th anniversary of the Hall.
